## Column width

These are the different page width presets that content (including nested columns) can be situated within.

::: {.column-body style="background-color: #666666; border: solid black 1px;"}
::: {.text-center style="color: #ffffff; margin-top: 1em"}
Width = column-body (default)
:::
:::

::: {.column-body-outset style="background-color: #666666;; border: solid black 1px;"}
::: {.text-center style="color: #ffffff; margin-top: 1em"}
Width = column-body-outset
:::
:::

::: {.column-page-inset style="background-color: #666666;; border: solid black 1px;"}
::: {.text-center style="color: #ffffff; margin-top: 1em"}
Width = column-page-inset
:::
:::

::: {.column-page style="background-color: #666666; border: solid black 1px;"}
::: {.text-center style="color: #ffffff; margin-top: 1em"}
Width = column-page
:::
:::

::: {.column-screen-inset style="background-color: #666666; border: solid black 1px;"}
::: {.text-center style="color: #ffffff; margin-top: 1em"}
Width = column-screen-inset
:::
:::

::: {.column-screen style="background-color: #666666; border: solid black 1px;"}
::: {.text-center style="color: #ffffff; margin-top: 1em"}
Width = column-screen
